contextId.occurrenceNote: Paul is speaking of a situation that did not exist to emphasize that the inheritance came only by means of the promise. Alternate translation: "the inheritance comes to us by means of the promise, because we could not keep the demands of God's law" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hypo]])
contextId.quote: εἰ γὰρ ἐκ νόμου ἡ κληρονομία, οὐκέτι ἐξ ἐπαγγελίας
contextId.glQuote: For if the inheritance comes by the law, then it no longer comes by promise

contextId.occurrenceNote: Paul is describing a situation that does not exist to emphasize that people persecute him because he is preaching that God forgives people because of Jesus' work on the cross. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hypo]])
contextId.quote: ἄρα κατήργηται τὸ σκάνδαλον τοῦ σταυροῦ
contextId.glQuote: In that case the stumbling block of the cross has been removed
